009package imagingbook.common.color.quantize;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012
013import java.awt.image.IndexColorModel;
014
015import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
016import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
017import imagingbook.common.color.RgbUtils;
018
019public interface ColorQuantizer {
020        
021        public final static int MAX_RGB = 255;
022        
023        /**
024         * Retrieves the color map produced by this color quantizer.
025         * The returned array is in the format float[idx][rgb], where
026         * rgb = 0 (red), 1 (green), 2 (blue) and  0 &le; idx &lt; nColors.
027         * 
028         * @return The table of reference (quantization) colors.
029         */
030        public abstract float[][] getColorMap();
031        
032        // ---------------------------------------------------------------
033        
034        /**
035         * Performs color quantization on the given full-color RGB image
036         * and creates an indexed color image.
037         * 
038         * @param cp The original full-color RGB image.
039         * @return The quantized (indexed color) image.
040         */
041        public default ByteProcessor quantize(ColorProcessor cp) {
042                float[][] colormap = this.getColorMap();
043                if (colormap.length > 256) 
044                        throw new RuntimeException("cannot index to more than 256 colors");
045                
046                int w = cp.getWidth();
047                int h = cp.getHeight();
048                
049                int[]  rgbPixels = (int[]) cp.getPixels();
050                byte[] idxPixels = new byte[rgbPixels.length];
051
052                for (int i = 0; i < rgbPixels.length; i++) {
053                        idxPixels[i] = (byte) findColorIndex(rgbPixels[i], colormap);
054                }
055
056                IndexColorModel idxCm = makeIndexColorModel(colormap);
057                return new ByteProcessor(w, h, idxPixels, idxCm);
058        }
059        
060        static IndexColorModel makeIndexColorModel(float[][] colormap) {
061                final int nColors = colormap.length;
062                byte[] rMap = new byte[nColors];
063                byte[] gMap = new byte[nColors];
064                byte[] bMap = new byte[nColors];
065                for (int i = 0; i < nColors; i++) {
066                        rMap[i] = floatToUnsignedByte(colormap[i][0]);
067                        gMap[i] = floatToUnsignedByte(colormap[i][1]);
068                        bMap[i] = floatToUnsignedByte(colormap[i][2]);
069                }
070                return new IndexColorModel(8, nColors, rMap, gMap, bMap);
071        }
072        
073        static byte floatToUnsignedByte(float x) {
074                int xi = Math.round(x);
075                if (xi < 0) {
076                        xi = 0;
077                }
078                else if (xi > MAX_RGB) {
079                        xi = MAX_RGB;
080                }
081                return (byte) (0xFF & xi);
082        }
083        
084//      /**
085//       * Performs color quantization on the given sequence of
086//       * ARGB-encoded color values and returns a new sequence 
087//       * of quantized colors.
088//       * 
089//       * @param origPixels The original ARGB-encoded color values.
090//       * @return The quantized ARGB-encoded color values.
091//       */
092//      public int[] quantize(int[] origPixels) {
093//              int[] qantPixels = new int[origPixels.length];
094//              for (int i = 0; i < origPixels.length; i++) {
095//                      qantPixels[i] = quantize(origPixels[i]);
096//              }
097//              return qantPixels;
098//      }
099        
100//      /**
101//       * Performs color quantization on the given ARGB-encoded color 
102//       * value and returns the associated quantized color. 
103//       * @param p The original ARGB-encoded color value.
104//       * @return The quantized ARGB-encoded color value.
105//       */
106//      public int quantize(int p) {
107//              int[][] colormap = getColorMap();
108//              int idx = findColorIndex(p);
109//              int red = colormap[idx][0];
110//              int grn = colormap[idx][1];
111//              int blu = colormap[idx][2];
112//              return RgbUtils.rgbToInt(red, grn, blu);
113//      }
114        
115        /**
116         * Finds the color table index of the color that is "closest" to the supplied
117         * RGB color (minimum Euclidean distance in color space). 
118         * This method may be overridden by inheriting classes, for example, to use
119         * quick indexing in the octree method.
120         *  
121         * @param p Original color, encoded as an ARGB integer.
122         * @param colormap a color map (float)
123         * @return The associated color table index.
124         */
125        default int findColorIndex(int p, float[][] colormap) {
126//              float[][] colormap = getColorMap();
127                int[] rgb = RgbUtils.intToRgb(p);
128                int n = colormap.length;
129                float minD2 = Float.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
130                int minIdx = -1;
131                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
132                        final float red = colormap[i][0];
133                        final float grn = colormap[i][1];
134                        final float blu = colormap[i][2];
135                        float d2 = sqr(red - rgb[0]) + sqr(grn - rgb[1]) + sqr(blu - rgb[2]);   // dist^2
136                        if (d2 < minD2) {
137                                minD2 = d2;
138                                minIdx = i;
139                        }
140                }
141                return minIdx;
142        }
143        
144        default void listColorMap() {
145                float[][] colormap = getColorMap();
146                System.out.println("listColorMap: " + colormap.length);
147                int n = colormap.length;
148                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
149                        float red = colormap[i][0];
150                        float grn = colormap[i][1];
151                        float blu = colormap[i][2];
152                        System.out.println(String.format("i=%3d: r=%6.1f g=%6.1f b=%6.1f", i, red, grn, blu));
153                }
154        }
155        
156        // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
157        
158//      protected int log2(int n){
159//              if(n <= 0) throw new IllegalArgumentException();
160//              return 31 - Integer.numberOfLeadingZeros(n);
161//      }
162        
163//      protected int sqr(int k) {
164//              return k * k;
165//      }
166
167}
